node.title: setup: Prepare flare for Release as an NPM Package
node.body:
# Description
Make the necessary changes to the code structure and set up additional configurations for the successful release of flare as an npm package. This includes ensuring a modular and well-organized codebase, configuring metadata files (like package.json), defining entry points, managing dependencies, and setting up the necessary scripts for building, testing, and packaging.

# Motivation
Releasing flare as an npm package will make it more accessible to the community, enabling easy installation, usage, and contribution. A well-structured package with clear metadata and setup instructions is crucial for a successful release.

- Define the main entry point of the package.
- Dependencies:
- List the necessary dependencies in the package.json file.
- Scripts:
 - Set up scripts for building, testing, and any other necessary setup steps.

# Documentation:
Include comprehensive documentation that guides users on how to install, configure, and use flare after installing it as an npm package.

# Expected Outcome
Upon successful completion of these tasks, flare will be ready for release as an npm package. Developers will be able to easily install it via npm and utilize its functionalities within their projects.
Please reach out to me on discord server, we can discuss the next steps there. Feel free to ask any questions, can pair program on this issue.

node.title: Compiling examples on linux
node.body:
I have cloned the repo locally on my linux computer and I could not compile the examples, while building the dependencies, winit complained that it couldn't compile winit for my platform.

Following https://github.com/djeedai/bevy_hanabi/issues/170, I have changed `default-features = true` for bevy in the cargo.toml and then it works.

node.title: [Solution] -Leetcode 35. Search Insert Position in C++
node.body:
### Description

# 35. Search Insert Position

The problem requires finding the index at which a target value should be inserted into a sorted array of distinct integers while maintaining the sorted order. If the target is already in the array, we return its index. the thought is to use a binary search algorithm to efficiently find the insertion point.

The problem will be solved in C++ programming language.


### DSA Problem

Given a sorted array of distinct integers and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be if it were inserted in order.
You must write an algorithm with O(log n) runtime complexity.

Example 1:
Input: nums = [1,3,5,6], target = 5
Output: 2

Example 2:
Input: nums = [1,3,5,6], target = 2
Output: 1

Example 3:
Input: nums = [1,3,5,6], target = 7
Output: 4
carry on with this problem

Happy problem-solving.

node.title: Implementar utilitário para capitalização de strings em Python
node.body:
**Seu pedido de recurso está relacionado a um problema? Por favor, descreva.**
Desejamos adicionar um novo utilitário à nossa biblioteca em Python que permita a capitalização de strings de acordo com regras específicas. A capitalização envolve a transformação da primeira letra de cada palavra em maiúscula e o restante das letras em minúscula. No entanto, queremos oferecer a capacidade de personalizar essa capitalização para manter certas palavras em letras maiúsculas ou minúsculas, de acordo com as regras estabelecidas.

**Descreva a solução que você gostaria**
- Criar uma função chamada `capitalize` que aceite uma string como entrada e opções para personalizar a capitalização. As opções podem incluir:

1. lower_case_words (lista de strings): Uma lista de palavras que devem ser mantidas em letras minúsculas, mesmo que apareçam no meio da string. Exemplo: Preposições
2. upper_case_words (lista de strings): Uma lista de palavras que devem ser mantidas em letras maiúsculas. Exemplo: Acrônimos
```
- A função capitalize_string deve operar da seguinte forma:

1. Divide a string de entrada em palavras, usando um espaço em branco como separador.
2. Filtra as palavras resultantes para remover palavras vazias ou nulas.
3. Itera sobre as palavras e, para cada palavra:
4. Converte a palavra em letras minúsculas.
5. Verifica se a palavra está na lista lower_case_words. Se estiver, mantém a palavra em letras minúsculas.
6. Verifica se a palavra está na lista upper_case_words. Se estiver, mantém a palavra em letras maiúsculas.
7. Caso contrário, torna a primeira letra da palavra maiúscula e o restante da palavra em letras minúsculas.
8. Junta as palavras novamente em uma única string, separadas por espaços, e retorna a string capitalizada.
```

**Descreva alternativas que você considerou**
- Criar um novo utilitário `capitalize`:
```python
def capitalize(string):
...
```
Exemplo de Uso:
```python
from brutils import capitalize

>>> capitalize_string("exemplo DE string")
"Exemplo de String"
>>> capitalize_string("exemplo DE String", lower_case_words=["de"])
"Exemplo de String"
>>> capitalize_string("exemplo de String", upper_case_words=["exemplo"])
"EXEMPLO de String"
```
**Contexto adicional**

Pensando aqui, acho que essa o próprio Python já cobre bem. Porque temos:

- capitalize(): para transformar a primeira letra maiúscula https://www.w3schools.com/python/ref_string_capitalize.asp
- title(): para transformar a primeira letra de cada palavra maiúscula https://www.w3schools.com/python/ref_string_title.asp
- upper(): para transformar tudo em maiúscula https://www.w3schools.com/python/ref_string_upper.asp
- lower(): para transforma tudo em minúscula https://www.w3schools.com/python/ref_string_lower.asp

Não sei bem ao certo o motivo de terem criado esse utilitário no brutils js, mas acho que em Python não precisaria.

O quê você acha @antoniamaia ?
Beleuza!!

node.title: Exceptions thrown in filters result in 500's by default
node.body:
**Describe the bug**
Whenever an exception is thrown in a filter, in results in a  500.  

As an example, if you try to use an API with an invalid token, the filter will throw a `NotAuthorized` exception, which should result in a 4xx error.  Instead, a 500 is thrown.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Get a valid token by logging into the admin UI, locally. 
2. Simlate an identity API call, such as
```
curl --location --request GET 'localhost:8381/identities' \
--header 'Accept: application/vnd.iridium.id.identity-response.1+json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer $2a$10$xyi4epfHmUrTnXwB/zIQo.X2dHCHHtkGTjnPmOKHXb/mw9QwKkkDq' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' 
```
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

A 401 error should be thrown

node.title: Add option --stop-on-failure
node.body:
## Currently

If a test fails, the runner will continue until finalising all tests

## Expected

Add a new option `--stop-on-failure` that will force to stop the runner right after encountering one failing test.

> Inspired by PHPUnit: https://docs.phpunit.de/en/10.3/configuration.html#the-stoponfailure-attribute

### HINT

1. Look at how the _SIMPLE_OUTPUT is implemented
2. Look at the existing command options in the entry point of bashunit: https://github.com/TypedDevs/bashunit/blob/main/bashunit 

```bash
# for example:
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  argument="$1"
  case $argument in
    ...
    --stop-on-failure)      
      _STOP_ON_FAILURE=true
      shift
      ;;
    ...
  esac
done
```

Then, we could check that global variable inside the `function console_results::print_failed_test()` and if it's true then force an `exit 1`
Hello, in which file should it go?
Hi, @Franqsanz ! I added some HINTS in the issue description. Let us know if you need more help

I ask you @Chemaclass, this should be like this ?

```shell
_FILTER=""
_SIMPLE_OUTPUT=false
_STOP_ON_FAILURE=false
_FILES=()

while [[[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  argument="$1"
  case $argument in
    -f|--filter)
      _FILTER="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    -s|--simple)
      _SIMPLE_OUTPUT=true
      shift
      ;;
    -v|--version)
      console_header::print_version
      trap '' EXIT && exit 0
      ;;
    --stop-on-failure)
      _STOP_ON_FAILURE=true
      shift
      ;;
    *)
      while IFS='' read -r line; do
        _FILES+=("$line");
      done < <(helpers::find_files_recursive "$argument")
      shift
      ;;
  esac
done

console_header::print_version_with_env
runner::load_test_files "$_FILTER" "${_FILES[@]}"

exit 0
```

I'm having trouble understanding it at the moment
Yes, that's the first part. Now you need to use that variable inside the function responsible to render the failing tests

Hi, I'm kind of lost, it would be something like this what is missing? 

```shell
if [ "$_STOP_ON_FAILURE" = true ]; then
  console_results::print_failed_test
fi
```

I'm sure it's simple the missing part but I have no shell experience and it's hard for me to understand it. 😅

This would look something like this ?

```shell
if [[ $test_result_code -ne 0 ]]; then
   state::add_tests_failed
   console_results::print_error_test "$function_name" "$test_result_code"

   if [ "$_STOP_ON_FAILURE" = true ]; then
     console_results::print_failed_test "$function_name" "$test_result_code"
     exit 1
   fi

   return
fi
```
If this is not the case, you can assign it to someone else, I don't want to take more time, anyway thanks for the help.
@Franqsanz, can you try creating a PR with your changing suggestions? This way you can test it yourself as well.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The current architecture of addon is such that it will stop sending more malicious requests after one vulnerability is reported. We need to enhance the addon to continue sending more requests and this will be based on the flag from the UI. If the flag is true then continue sending the requests.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
File upload addon has a ui:
![image](https://github.com/SasanLabs/owasp-zap-fileupload-addon/assets/13570884/956a0734-0b0a-4d86-a248-d60061e67d20)

We will add a new checkbox which is to continue running after finding the vulnerability. This way it will help users to find all the vulnerabilities in there web application.

@TomerPacific got the issue. So when we run `./gradlew install`, it tries to install the addon into the owasp zap's running instance and as the instance is not running in the machine, it is failing to connect.

Solution is:
instead of running `./gradlew install`, use following command:
`./gradlew jarZapAddOn`

In order to know more about this, you can run `./gradlew tasks` command and it will show all the options with description.

Sorry for all the hassle.

Currently, you can use the option `-s|--simple` when running `./bashunit` to display dots instead of the test names.

Allow defining `SIMPLE_OUTPUT` in the .env with a default:false,

The .env configuration must be overwritten by the command configuration.

node.title: Above should (goal) - speed up boot process of no load from 40ms to less than 10ms - and with ~2 services from 200ms to < 50ms

Change boot order - instead of all plugins loaded, and then sift through them - first load config/config-default - work out what plugins should be loaded, then load logging, followed by events and then finally the services.
Change plugin mapping from (plugin name) -> (mapped name) to be (mapped name) -> (plugin/service path) - so multiple services of the same name can be run with different configurations
Remove the search for plugins - use plugin definitions in the sec.config.yaml file instead - in order to speed up the startup process
Migrate code coverage tool from `c8` to `codecov`
node.body:
### Background:
We currently use `c8` as the code coverage tool, while it is useful to see the coverage as we run tests locally on the command-line terminal, it would be great to also add a tool that does CICD integration.

### Task Details:
Integrate `codecov` with our CICD.

A couple of min-bar requirements that comes to mind:

- [ ] The README.md shows the latest updated code coverage numbers.
- [ ] Showing code coverage delta/difference for each submitted PR.
- [ ] Have a customized `codecov.yml` tailored to our needs:
    1. Require 100% coverage on new code
    1. Require coverage to never drop
    1. Exclude interface/type files if needed
    
Example (incomplete) snippet of `codecov.yml`:

```yaml
component_management:
  default_rules:
    statuses:
      - type: project
        target: auto # auto compares coverage to the previous base commit
        threshold: 0% # do not allow coverage drop from the previous base commit coverage
      - type: patch
        target: 100 # all new code should be tested 
```

There is a precedence that we can follow in [`web5-js` repo](https://github.com/TBD54566975/web5-js#web5-js-sdk), you can probably locate the PR/commit in its commit history and copy the pattern/code from there.


## Picking Up This Issue:
- If you'd like to work on this, please comment "picking this up" below, and I'll assign the issue to you 

## Questions:
- If you need assistance or clarification, feel free to comment below.
- Feeling overwhelmed? Join our [`#hack-together` channel](https://discord.gg/tbd) and collaborate with a buddy.
- New to open-source? Check out our [Hacktober `#getting-started` channel](https://discord.gg/tbd).
- [Leaderboard](https://github.com/TBD54566975/developer.tbd.website/issues/721): Check your ranking after finishing this task.

### Resources:
- **Creating a Pull Request**: If you're new to GitHub and unsure how to create a pull request, follow this [step-by-step guide](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request).

Remember, communication is key! If you have any questions or face any challenges, we're here to help so please don't hesitate to reach out.

Good Luck! 🍁

node.title: Need for detail in the content of the branches
node.body:
### Issue Description

We're encountering a challenge with the current state of the branch content. It lacks the necessary level of detail and clarity, making it difficult for team members to quickly understand the purpose and changes associated with each branch.

### Proposed Solution

To address this issue, we propose enhancing the content of the branches to include comprehensive information such as:
- Detailed descriptions of changes and features associated with each branch.
- Any relevant context or references to related issues, tasks, or user stories.
- Instructions or guidance for testing, deployment, or integration specific to the branch.
- Any other essential information that would aid team members in comprehending the purpose and progress of the branch.

By implementing this enhancement, we aim to streamline collaboration, improve efficiency, and ensure that everyone involved has a clear understanding of the ongoing development efforts.

### Acceptance Criteria

- Branch content includes detailed descriptions of changes and features.
- Branch content references relevant issues, tasks, or user stories.
- Branch content provides guidance for testing, deployment, or integration if applicable.
- Team members find the branch content clear and informative, facilitating their understanding of ongoing work.
@CyberGeni

node.title: Show Detail Screen error handling
node.body:
As a movie streaming app user,
I want to be informed of any internet connectivity or API issues when accessing the show details screen,
so that I understand why content might not be loading and can take appropriate action.

If there's no internet connection, a clear message should be displayed stating "No internet connection. Please check your network settings."
If the app's API fails to load data, a message should be displayed stating "Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later."
The user should have the option to retry fetching data with a "Retry" button or action.
There should be an icon or visual cue accompanying the error message to quickly indicate the type of issue (e.g., a disconnected plug icon for internet issues).
If possible, previously loaded data (if any) should still be displayed or cached to allow users to access some content even if the API fails momentarily.
The rest of the UI should remain responsive and accessible even if there's an error on the show details screen content.
Error messages should be brief but clear, avoiding technical jargon to ensure all users understand the issue.
I started working on it.🖐️

As a series enthusiast,
I want to browse a screen dedicated to trending shows displayed in a grid format with endless pagination
so that I can continuously discover and explore the most popular shows without interruptions.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The trending shows screen should be easily accessible from home sections with a "More" button.
2. Shows should be displayed as thumbnails in a grid format.
4. Upon scrolling to the bottom of the list, the next set of trending shows should automatically load (endless pagination).
5. There should be a visual indication (e.g., loading spinner) while new shows are being fetched.
6. In case of a network error or no more trending shows available, an appropriate message should be displayed to the user.
7. Tapping on a shows thumbnail should take the user to the detailed shows description screen.


Feel free to create separate PRs to implement this story

node.title: Formatar o número do Processo Jurídico
node.body:
**Seu pedido de recurso está relacionado a um problema? Por favor, descreva.**
Dada uma String correspondente a um número de Processo Jurídico válido, retornar uma String correspondendo a este número formatada com traço e pontos.

```
NNNNNNN-DD.AAAA.J.TR.0000
```

**Descreva a solução que você gostaria**
- Chamar um novo utilitário passando uma String correspondente a um número de Processo Jurídico válido e retornar uma String correspondendo a este número formatada com traço e pontos.
- A String deve estar sem formatação, sem símbolos.
- Caso o número passado como parâmetro não seja válido, retornar None.

**Descreva alternativas que você considerou**
- Criar um novo utilitário `format_processo_juridico`:
```python
def format_processo_juridico(processo_juridico):
...
```
Exemplo de Uso:
```python
from brutils import format_processo_juridico

>>> format_processo_juridico("43414808720123008584")
"4341480-87.2012.3.00.8584"
>>> format_processo_juridico("16198256620197006253")
"1619825-66.2019.7.00.6253"
>>> format_processo_juridico("07799120166000729")
None
```
**Contexto adicional**
Referências úteis:
[Estrutura da numeração única de processo](https://btcreditos.com.br/blog/numero-cnj-o-que-e-a-numeracao-unica-de-processo/#:~:text=A%20estrutura%20da%20numera%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20%C3%BAnica%20de%20processo%20%C3%A9%20formada%20por,respectivo%20segmento%20ou%20circunscri%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20judici%C3%A1ria)

node.title: [FEAT]: add missing endpoints
node.body:
### Describe the need

Hey
I've noticed some endpoints are missing from Octokit, specifically I've had a need to [list](https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/rest/reactions/reactions?apiVersion=2022-11-28#list-reactions-for-a-release), [create](https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/rest/reactions/reactions?apiVersion=2022-11-28#create-reaction-for-a-release) and [delete](https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/rest/reactions/reactions?apiVersion=2022-11-28#delete-a-release-reaction) a release's reactions.

From what I can see it should be as easy as adding this to [client/reactions.rb](https://github.com/octokit/octokit.rb/blob/main/lib/octokit/client/reactions.rb) and throw in a couple tests which I'd be willing to do if you're open to the idea.
```ruby
module Octokit
  class Client
    module Reactions
      # List reactions for a release
      #
      # @param repo [Integer, String, Hash, Repository] A GitHub repository
      # @param id [Integer] The Release id
      #
      # @see https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/rest/reactions/reactions?apiVersion=2022-11-28#list-reactions-for-a-release
      #
      # @example
      #   @client.release_reactions("octokit/octokit.rb", 1)
      #
      # @return [Array<Sawyer::Resource>] Array of Hashes representing the reactions.
      def release_reactions(repo, id, options = {})
        get "#{Repository.path repo}/releases/#{id}/reactions", options
      end

      # Create reaction for a release
      #
      # @param repo [Integer, String, Hash, Repository] A GitHub repository
      # @param id [Integer] The Release id
      # @param reaction [String] The Reaction
      #
      # @see https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/rest/reactions/reactions?apiVersion=2022-11-28#create-reaction-for-a-release
      # @see https://developer.github.com/v3/reactions/#reaction-types
      #
      # @example
      #   @client.create_release_reaction("octokit/octokit.rb", 1)
      #
      # @return [<Sawyer::Resource>] Hash representing the reaction.
      def create_release_reaction(repo, id, reaction, options = {})
        options = options.merge(content: reaction)
        post "#{Repository.path repo}/releases/#{id}/reactions", options
      end

      # Delete a reaction for a release
      #
      # @param repo [Integer, String, Hash, Repository] A GitHub repository
      # @param issue_id [Integer] The Release id
      # @param reaction_id [Integer] The Reaction id
      #
      # @see https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/rest/reactions/reactions?apiVersion=2022-11-28#delete-a-release-reaction
      #
      # @example
      #   @client.delete_release_reaction("octokit/octokit.rb", 1, 2)
      #
      # @return [Boolean] Return true if reaction was deleted, false otherwise.
      def delete_release_reaction(repo, release_id, reaction_id, options = {})
        boolean_from_response :delete, "#{Repository.path repo}/releases/#{release_id}/reactions/#{reaction_id}", options
      end
    end
  end
end
```

### SDK Version

_No response_

### API Version

2022-11-28

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

👋 Hi! Thank you for this contribution! Just to let you know, our GitHub SDK team does a round of issue and PR reviews twice a week, every Monday and Friday! We have a [process in place](https://github.com/octokit/.github/blob/main/community/prioritization_response.md#overview) for prioritizing and responding to your input.  Because you are a part of this community please feel free to comment, add to, or pick up any issues/PRs that are labled with `Status: Up for grabs`. You & others like you are the reason all of this works! So thank you & happy coding! 🚀

Hey thank you for highlighting these missing APIs.  You are correct, until we can get to generative SDKs, the SDKs have to be added manually.

I am going to assign the labels `hacktoberfest` and `Up for Grabs` to signal to the community that this is something that has been verified and can be worked. It looks like you'd be up for this so please feel free to pick the issue up! Thank you again for all that you do for this community :heart: !
